Article.ArticleTitle: Pre- and postnatal MR imaging of an asymptomatic giant hypothalamic hamartoma.

Abstract.AbstractText: Hypothalamic hamartomas are rare tumors that are most often diagnosed in early childhood. These lesions are classified as giant hypothalamic hamartomas when they exceed 4 cm in any 1 dimension. The most common presenting symptoms associated with these lesions are precocious puberty, gelastic seizures, and (less commonly) syndromic conditions such as Pallister-Hall syndrome. We present a unique case of an asymptomatic giant hypothalamic hamartoma diagnosed prenatally by fetal magnetic resonance imaging and followed throughout infancy. This case demonstrates the utility of multimetric analysis using difference sequences, including diffuse-weighted imaging, to assess specific properties of intracranial lesions detected in utero and to aid in accurate diagnosis prior to birth.
